00:00:10:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:10:100000.Dialogue: Is there too much pepper on your salad?

00:00:11:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:11:220000.Dialogue: I don't put pepper on salads.

00:00:13:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:020000.Dialogue: I've heard enough. Sit over there.

00:00:14:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:14:060000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. I don't want to sit by myself.

00:00:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:17:230000.Dialogue: That's what Typhoid Mary said, and clearly, her friends buckled.

00:00:24:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:24:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's just one sneeze. You're on your own.

00:00:29:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:29:150000.Dialogue: Oh, Leonard, I have something for you. Per our roommate agreement, this is your 24-hour notice that I will be having a non-related female spending two nights in our apartment.

00:00:41:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:41:050000.Dialogue: When you say "non-related female," you still mean human, right?

00:00:45:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:45:130000.Dialogue: Of course. Pets are banned under the roommate agreement, with the exception of service animals, such as seeing eye dogs and, one day, cybernetically- enhanced helper monkeys.

00:00:55:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:55:040000.Dialogue: Are you planning on kidnapping a woman?

00:01:00:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:00:180000.Dialogue: Yes, but mixed with genuine concern.

00:01:04:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:04:110000.Dialogue: For your information, I'll be playing host to Dr. Elizabeth Plimpton.

00:01:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:210000.Dialogue: Yes. And until you acquire a surgical mask, please address your comments to me through a napkin.

00:01:18:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:18:200000.Dialogue: We've been corresponding for years about our mutual interest in gravitational wave signatures of inflatons in the early universe. And now she's under consideration for a position at our university.

00:01:29:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:29:000000.Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me you knew Elizabeth Plimpton? I am a huge fan of hers!

00:01:33:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:33:230000.Dialogue: I didn't realize I was obligated to share my connection with things you're a fan of, but very well. You enjoy Canadian bacon. I've been to Toronto.

00:01:41:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:41:190000.Dialogue: Okay, fine. Where is she going to sleep?

00:01:52:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:52:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, um, I have a two-part question.

00:01:56:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:56:020000.Dialogue: A) Are you kidding me? And B) seriously, are you freaking kidding me?

00:02:01:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:01:000000.Dialogue: A) I rarely kid. And B) when I do kid, you will know it by my use of the word "bazinga."

00:02:08:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:08:010000.Dialogue: So you're saying the two of you are going to be sleeping in the same bed?

00:02:21:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:21:120000.Dialogue: Thank you. Why is a world- renowned scientist staying in our apartment instead of a hotel?

00:02:27:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:27:100000.Dialogue: Well, she doesn't care for hotels. And who can blame her? Windows that don't open, multi-user linens, keys shaped like credit cards- as if one walks around with unassigned slots in one's wallet.

00:02:37:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:37:200000.Dialogue: All right, I believe I have time for one more question. Yes, Raj?

00:02:43:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:43:230000.Dialogue: When can I sit with you again?

00:02:45:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:45:220000.Dialogue: When I've seen two consecutive negative throat cultures spaced 12 hours apart. You know the drill. All right, if you'll excuse me, I am off to start a prophylactic course of antibiotics.

00:02:58:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:58:230000.Dialogue: I can't believe he's friends with Elizabeth Plimpton.

00:03:01:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:01:210000.Dialogue: I can't believe they let him into Canada.

00:03:04:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:04:140000.Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You heard the man. Where's your throat cultures?

00:03:47:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:180000.Dialogue: Oh, Penny, excellent. I have a question about these maxi pads.

00:03:52:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:52:190000.Dialogue: Are the wings truly functional or have I fallen victim to marketing hype?

00:03:58:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:58:020000.Dialogue: What? Why are you doing with-- what?

00:04:01:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:01:200000.Dialogue: The stock boy at Walgreens was frustratingly uninformed on the subject.

00:04:05:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:05:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what are you doing with maxi pads?

00:04:08:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:08:120000.Dialogue: I have a lady friend who will be staying with me for a few days.

00:04:14:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:14:120000.Dialogue: I want her to feel at home. I also bought scented soaps, pantyhose, Midol, calcium chews and what is apparently a yogurt specifically designed to regulate the female bowel.

00:04:28:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:28:220000.Dialogue: Wait, wait, hold on, back up. You're having a woman stay with you?

00:04:32:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:32:080000.Dialogue: Yes. Why does that seem to flabbergast everybody?

00:04:35:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:35:090000.Dialogue: Oh... no, no, no, no. I'm not flabbergasted. I'm... puzzled. Yeah, let's go with puzzled.

00:04:42:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:42:220000.Dialogue: A word of warning. My guest is a noted physicist and the leading expert on quantum cosmology, so please try to avoid wasting her time with female jibber jabber.

00:04:55:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:55:010000.Dialogue: Shoe sales, hair styles, mud masks, gossip about your friends Brad and Angelina.

00:05:04:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:04:020000.Dialogue: I'm not surprised, considering the way you talk about them behind their backs.

00:05:11:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:11:230000.Dialogue: She's here, she's here. How do I look? Do I look smart?

00:05:16:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:16:150000.Dialogue: Oh, good grief. This isn't about you. Coming! Now, listen. One of the great minds of the 21st century is about to play host to one of the other great minds of the 21st century.

00:05:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:28:050000.Dialogue: So pay attention. Years from now, my biographer might ask you about this event.

00:05:34:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:34:160000.Dialogue: Oh, I have so many things to tell your biographer.

00:05:39:170000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:05:39:170000.Dialogue: Dr. Cooper, thank goodness. I completely forgot your address. But then I remembered that I'd written it on my hand.

00:05:45:130000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:05:45:130000.Dialogue: Lucky for me, I didn't confuse it with what I'd written on my other hand, which are the coordinates for a newly discovered neutron star. 'Cause if I tried to go there, I'd be crushed by hypergravity.

00:05:58:070000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:05:58:070000.Dialogue: Nice to finally meet you in person.

00:06:04:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:04:090000.Dialogue: This is my friend and roommate, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter.

00:06:07:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:07:020000.Dialogue: Hi-lo. Oops. I-I started to say "hi," and then I switched to "hello" in the middle. It came out "hi-lo."

00:06:16:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:16:170000.Dialogue: Duh. Uh, it's nice to meet you. I-I've read both your books and most of your papers. I-I'm Leonard, I live here, you're brilliant.

00:06:27:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:27:030000.Dialogue: I apologize. He's only an experimental physicist.

00:06:30:160000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:06:30:160000.Dialogue: No need to apologize. Some of my best friends are experimental physicists. Well, not my best friends, but I know them.

00:06:38:220000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:06:38:220000.Dialogue: My best friend is a molecular chemist named Wendy. I'm sorry, I'm rambling. Hi-lo.

00:06:46:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:46:040000.Dialogue: Are you hungry, thirsty? Can I offer you anything?

00:06:48:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:48:070000.Dialogue: No, she's my guest. If anyone should offer her anything, it should be me. Elizabeth, can I get you something? Perhaps a feminine hygiene product or a bowel-regulating yogurt?

00:06:57:110000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:06:57:110000.Dialogue: Interesting choices. Based on my current needs, I guess I'd pick the yogurt.

00:07:02:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:02:020000.Dialogue: Excellent. If the yogurt works, I bought some delightful scented candles.

00:07:16:140000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:07:16:140000.Dialogue: Thank you so much for opening up your home to me.

00:07:19:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:19:120000.Dialogue: Well, who wants to stay in a hotel? Windows that don't open, those crazy card-shaped keys.

00:07:27:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:27:180000.Dialogue: No, he doesn't understand. I understand.

00:07:37:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:37:050000.Dialogue: I think any university would want you. Except, of course, any university that had already had you. Because they would've already wanted you before they, you know, got you.

00:07:47:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:47:200000.Dialogue: From the mind that brought you "hi-lo."

00:07:52:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:52:090000.Dialogue: Let me show you to your room.

00:07:54:130000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:07:54:130000.Dialogue: All right. I guess I am tired. Good night, Leonard.

00:07:59:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:59:070000.Dialogue: I mean, obously, good night. I started to say "sleep tight," then I changed my mind in the middle. I swear to God, I'm smart.

00:08:13:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:13:080000.Dialogue: All right, let me show you some of the features of the room. First, windows. Conventional. Open, closed. Open, closed. Halfway open. Or halfway closed, depending on your philosophical bent.

00:08:29:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:29:030000.Dialogue: Over here is my comic book collection. Feel free to browse. There's a box of disposable reading gloves on the night stand.

00:08:38:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:38:090000.Dialogue: In here, you'll find emergency provisions. An eight-day supply of food and water, a crossbow, season two of Star Trek: The Original Series on a high-density flash drive.

00:08:50:040000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:08:50:040000.Dialogue: What if there's a disaster that destroys all the USB ports?

00:08:53:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:070000.Dialogue: Then there's really no reason to live, is there?

00:08:56:050000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:08:56:050000.Dialogue: Can I ask a question about your roommate?

00:08:59:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:010000.Dialogue: He's an odd duck, isn't he?

00:09:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:03:230000.Dialogue: Well, there was a misbegotten adventure with a waitress who lives across the hall. It ended as inexplicably as it began. They had very little in common, except for carnal activity. That's why I acquired these noise-canceling headphones. If you decide to use them, please clean the ear pieces afterwards with the Wet Wipes you'll find in the bathroom. They're in the drawer labeled "Wet Wipes."

00:09:28:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:28:010000.Dialogue: Good. I'll leave you to your nighttime ablutions. I've e-mailed you the morning bathroom schedule. You'll also find a laminated copy in your welcome packet.

00:09:38:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:38:120000.Dialogue: It's on the back of the emergency escape route diagram.

00:09:45:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:45:080000.Dialogue: Oh, let me just get one thing. It's my backup emergency supply kit. The living room escape route doesn't pass through here. Now, good night. And if there's an apocalypse, good luck.

00:10:03:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:03:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:05:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:05:070000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:10:08:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:08:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:09:110000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:09:110000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:10:11:080000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:11:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:11:080000.Dialogue: Me neither. Oh, look what I'm reading. It's you.

00:10:16:150000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:16:150000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:10:16:150000.Dialogue: I thought you already read it.

00:10:18:060000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:18:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:18:060000.Dialogue: I did, but it's been a while, and I wanted to sound smart over breakfast.

00:10:23:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:23:050000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:10:25:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:25:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:26:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:26:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:26:070000.Dialogue: Wasn't sure it was coming across.

00:10:27:200000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:27:200000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:10:30:050000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:30:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:31:170000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:31:170000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:10:31:170000.Dialogue: Oh, the extragalactic distance ladder. Want to know a little secret?

00:10:37:080000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:37:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:39:020000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:39:020000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:10:39:020000.Dialogue: I wrote the section on the Wilson-Bappu Effect completely naked.

00:10:45:110000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:45:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:45:110000.Dialogue: Really? Uh, sure doesn't read that way.

00:10:49:190000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:10:49:190000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:10:49:190000.Dialogue: Here, let me show yo When we consider the brightness of pulsating variable stars, we start to see a possible explanation for some of the discrepancies found in Hubble's constant.

00:11:03:070000.Scene: Leonard’s bedroom. There is a knock on the door.
00:11:03:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:06:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:06:130000.Dialogue: You really make science come alive.

00:11:31:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:31:020000.Dialogue: Vocal test. Morning vocal test. Second vocal test. Second morning vocal test.

00:11:41:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:010000.Dialogue: Morning. I trust you had a pleasant night.

00:11:49:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:49:230000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm going to relieve myself.

00:11:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:100000.Dialogue: How do you take your coffee?

00:12:00:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:00:070000.Dialogue: Pee for Houston, pee for Austin,

00:12:02:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:02:110000.Dialogue: pee for the state my heart got lost in.

00:12:19:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:19:200000.Dialogue: All right, Elizabeth, the bathroom is yours. The seat is down, and has been sanitized for your protection.

00:12:26:060000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:12:26:060000.Dialogue: That's very thoughtful, but I think I'll finish my coffee first.

00:12:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:30:090000.Dialogue: Ah, so the yogurt didn't work.

00:12:33:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:33:090000.Dialogue: I'll fire off a critical e-mail to the manufacturer.

00:12:37:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:37:180000.Dialogue: Oh, good, you're up. Look, my car won't start. I need a ride to work.

00:12:41:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:41:100000.Dialogue: Did you once again ignore your "check engine" light?

00:12:43:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:43:180000.Dialogue: No, Mr. smarty-pants. I ignored the "fill gas tank" light.

00:12:48:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:030000.Dialogue: Leonard, Penny wants to exploit any residual feelings you have for her in order to get a ride to work.

00:12:53:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:53:140000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, sure, let me just put this in a travel mug.

00:12:59:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:59:100000.Dialogue: Oh, Penny, this is Dr. Plimpton-- a leading expert on quantum cosmology. Dr. Plimpton, Penny is a waitress who doesn't understand the role gasoline plays in the internal combustion engine.

00:13:12:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:12:230000.Dialogue: Nice to meet you, too. Are you enjoying your stay?

00:13:21:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:21:230000.Dialogue: Wonderful. Meaningless pleasantries accomplished. Elizabeth, Leonard's bathroom time is coming up, and believe me, you do not want to follow him.

00:13:32:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:32:230000.Dialogue: Okay, well, I guess I should get dressed so I can take everyone to work. You and Sheldon and Sheldon's friend, Dr. Plimpton, who you just met. Gonna be fun. Like a clown car.

00:13:48:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:48:220000.Dialogue: Wha-- uh, you and me? Yeah, we did. Not too long ago. How are you doing with it?

00:13:52:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:52:210000.Dialogue: Not as good as you apparently.

00:13:56:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:56:140000.Dialogue: You know what? It's, it's none of my business. If you want to sleep with Sheldon's doctor buddy right after we stopped seeing each other, go for it.

00:14:04:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:070000.Dialogue: I'm uncomfortable with you recommending that Leonard pursue having intercourse with Dr. Plimpton, who I assure you has better things to do.

00:14:13:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:13:040000.Dialogue: I'm not recommending it. I'm saying it already happened.

00:14:26:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:26:130000.Dialogue: Come on. It wasn't my fault.

00:14:28:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:28:130000.Dialogue: The implication being that you sow tripped and fell into her lady parts?

00:14:35:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:35:020000.Dialogue: You know what? I'm just gonna take the bus to work.

00:14:38:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:38:010000.Dialogue: Penny, I can still drive you.

00:14:39:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:39:080000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, it's okay. You might slip on a banana peel and get me pregnant.

00:14:44:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:44:150000.Dialogue: I must say, I'm ocked by this betrayal.

00:14:54:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:54:020000.Dialogue: izabeth's my friend, and you're playingith her!

00:15:10:090000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:10:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:10:090000.Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?

00:15:11:190000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:11:190000.Speaker: Raj

00:15:14:100000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:14:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:16:060000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:16:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:16:060000.Dialogue: Maybe, but I don't care. That's the great thing about Nyquil, it's like ten-percent booze.

00:15:22:020000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:22:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:22:020000.Dialogue: I call it the nighttime sniffling, sneezing, coughing so you can talk to girls medicine.

00:15:27:210000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:27:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:27:210000.Dialogue: Are you having trouble sleeping? 'Cause, boy, I was up all night.

00:15:32:070000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:32:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:32:070000.Dialogue: Did you get a cold, too?

00:15:33:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:33:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:33:200000.Dialogue: No, but I was awake all night.

00:15:39:080000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:39:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:39:080000.Dialogue: If you want, I can give you some of my mom's sleeping pills.

00:15:44:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:44:230000.Speaker: Raj

00:15:45:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:45:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:45:230000.Dialogue: She doesn't kn she takes them.

00:15:49:050000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:15:49:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:49:050000.Dialogue: No, that's okay. It was something else keeping me up last night. And again this morning. And... I didn't mind.

00:16:01:110000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:01:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:01:110000.Dialogue: I was up last night. I was up this morning. I didn't mind. Those are your clues.

00:16:12:100000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:12:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:12:100000.Dialogue: Ooh, ooh. Did the pigeon on your windowsill have more babies?

00:16:17:010000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:17:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:18:190000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:18:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:18:190000.Dialogue: Were you up mang another stop-motion Legoovie?

00:16:21:110000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:21:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:22:220000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:22:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:22:220000.Dialogue: 'Cause let me tell you, it's not enough to make the Legos move, they also have to capture your heart.

00:16:27:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:27:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:27:230000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll give you one more clue. It involved another person.

00:16:32:100000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:32:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:32:100000.Dialogue: did you get a Japanese love pillow?

00:16:36:190000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:36:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:36:190000.Dialogue: How is a Japanese love pillow another person?

00:16:39:220000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:39:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:39:220000.Dialogue: It is if you love her and give her a name.

00:16:43:140000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:43:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:43:140000.Dialogue: Dr. Plimpton, I'd like you to meet my colleagues-- Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali Hi. and not-a-doctor Howard Wolowitz.

00:16:50:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:50:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:51:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:51:230000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:16:54:160000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:54:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:54:160000.Dialogue: And of course, you've already introduced yourself to Dr. Hofstadter.

00:16:58:210000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:16:58:210000.Speaker: Elizabeth

00:17:00:070000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:17:00:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:00:070000.Dialogue: Hey, you. Boy, I'm kind of tuckered out. How are you feeling, Elizabeth?

00:17:05:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:17:05:230000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:17:05:230000.Dialogue: You know what? I am a little tired. Would you be a dear and get me a cup of coffee?

00:17:11:040000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:17:11:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:13:230000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:17:13:230000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:17:13:230000.Dialogue: Actually, now I think I want it hot, brown and sweet.

00:17:18:000000.Scene: The cafeteria. Raj drinks from a hip flask.
00:17:18:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:26:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:26:130000.Dialogue: What do you mean "what? " It's Halo night.

00:17:28:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:28:110000.Dialogue: I can't. I'm too sick. Go away.

00:17:31:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:31:080000.Dialogue: That's why we moved Halo night here. Look, I brought my mom's chicken soup.

00:17:37:150000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:17:37:150000.Dialogue: Don't send him away. Let him in.

00:17:53:060000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:17:53:060000.Dialogue: Can I ask you a question, Howard? Do you like role-playing games?

00:17:58:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:58:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, sure. In fact, I'm a dungeon master.

00:18:04:070000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:18:04:070000.Dialogue: Not tonight. Tonight you are a delivery man. You brought soup, but uh-oh, Raj and I don't have enough money to pay you. So we'll have to come to some other kind of arrangement.

00:18:22:130000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:18:22:130000.Dialogue: You two figure out the details, I'm going to go change into something I don't mind getting ripped off my milky flesh.

00:18:33:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:33:070000.Dialogue: Go away. She wants New Delhi, not Kosher deli.

00:18:43:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:43:140000.Dialogue: I was waiting for the right time. This is the right time.

00:18:49:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:49:050000.Dialogue: Oh, this is like a nightmare. Get lost!

00:18:52:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:52:230000.Dialogue: He's right. The numbers are shaky enough as it is.

00:19:03:170000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:19:03:170000.Dialogue: What's going on is you and Howard are my moving men and Raj is my new landlord and I don't have enough money to pay any of you.

00:19:13:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:13:100000.Dialogue: Is she suggesting what I think she's suggesting?

00:19:16:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:16:210000.Dialogue: Yep. Welcome to the Penthouse Forum.

00:19:20:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:20:120000.Dialogue: Okay, show of hands. Who's up for this?

00:19:23:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:23:130000.Dialogue: We'll all be naked in front of each other. I'm out.

00:19:31:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:31:100000.Dialogue: Follow my lead. Almost. We're, we're going to go out into the hallway and, uh, make a dramatic entrance.

00:19:38:050000.Speaker: Elizabeth
00:19:38:050000.Dialogue: Oh, good. It's so much better when everyone commits.

00:19:41:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:41:000000.Dialogue: Run. Run, run, run. Don't look back.

00:19:42:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:42:230000.Dialogue: I thought we had something special.

00:19:50:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:50:060000.Dialogue: So, you say you can't pay your rent...

00:20:02:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:02:230000.Dialogue: I found these in the dryer. I'm assuming they belong to Sheldon.

00:20:06:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:06:150000.Dialogue: Thanks. It's really hard to find these in his size.

00:20:12:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:12:010000.Dialogue: So, listen. I've been meaning to talk to you about the other morning.

00:20:16:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:16:100000.Dialogue: You mean you and Dr. Slutbunny?

00:20:21:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:21:190000.Dialogue: Well, you don't owe me an explanation.

00:20:27:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:27:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm judging you nine ways to Sunday, but you don't owe me an explanation.

00:20:33:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:33:040000.Dialogue: Nevertheless, I'd like to get one on the record so you can understand why I did what I did.
